words.definition: An activity involving physical exertion and skill in which an individual or team competes against another or others for entertainment.
sentences: My favorite sport is basketball.
Playing a sport is a great way to stay active.
Many people watch sports on TV.

words.definition: The condition of being physically strong and healthy.
sentences: Regular exercise improves your fitness.
She works hard to maintain her fitness.
Good fitness is important for a healthy life.

words.definition: Activity requiring physical effort, carried out to sustain or improve health and fitness.
sentences: I do exercise every morning.
Exercise helps you feel good.
Walking is a simple form of exercise.

words.definition: A group of people working together, especially in a sport.
sentences: Our team won the championship.
Working as a team is important.
She plays on the school soccer team.

words.definition: A person taking part in a sport or game.
sentences: He is a skilled basketball player.
Each player has a role on the team.
The best player scored a goal.

words.definition: A person who trains an athlete or a team.
sentences: Our coach taught us new strategies.
The coach motivated the players.
She wants to be a soccer coach.

words.definition: A form of play or sport, especially a competitive one played according to rules.
sentences: We played a fun game of tennis.
The football game was very exciting.
What time does the game start?

words.definition: A contest in which people or teams compete against each other.
sentences: The tennis match lasted for hours.
Our team won the match.
They are preparing for their next match.

words.definition: An event or contest in which people compete.
sentences: She entered a swimming competition.
Competition can be fierce.
The competition was tough, but we did our best.

words.definition: A person or thing that wins something.
sentences: He was the winner of the race.
Everyone congratulated the winner.
The winner received a gold medal.

words.definition: A person or thing that loses a game or contest.
sentences: It's hard to be a good loser.
The loser shook the winner's hand.
No one likes to be a loser.

words.definition: The number of points, goals, runs, etc., achieved in a game or contest.
sentences: What's the score of the game?
He scored a goal in the last minute.
Our team had a high score.

words.definition: An act of scoring in a game or sport by sending the ball or puck into a target area.
sentences: He scored a fantastic goal.
The team needs one more goal to win.
The goalkeeper saved the goal.

words.definition: A unit of scoring in a game or sport.
sentences: We won by two points.
Each basket is worth two points.
She earned a point for her team.

words.definition: An act of defeating an enemy or opponent in a battle, game, or other competition.
sentences: The team celebrated their victory.
It was a great victory for our country.
Victory felt sweet after hard work.

words.definition: An act of losing a battle, game, or other competition.
sentences: The team accepted their defeat gracefully.
It was a tough defeat.
We learned from our defeat.

words.definition: A large, open-air venue with tiers of seats for spectators, used for sporting events and concerts.
sentences: The football game was held in a huge stadium.
The stadium was packed with fans.
Many famous events happen at this stadium.

words.definition: A level area surrounded by seating, in which sports, entertainments, and other public events are held.
sentences: The basketball game was held in the arena.
The singer performed in a large arena.
The arena was filled with cheering fans.

words.definition: A rectangular area marked out for playing tennis, basketball, or other games.
sentences: They played tennis on the court.
The basketball court was newly painted.
The players ran across the court.

words.definition: An area of open land, especially one planted with crops or pasture, or used for a particular purpose.
sentences: The soccer game was played on a green field.
The athletes trained on the field.
The field was muddy after the rain.

words.definition: An area of ground marked out or used for playing a game such as soccer or rugby.
sentences: The soccer pitch was in excellent condition.
The players ran onto the pitch.
The referee blew the whistle to start the match on the pitch.

words.definition: A prepared course or circuit for races, running, or other sports.
sentences: The runners trained on the track.
The car race was held on a long track.
She ran a lap around the track.

words.definition: A small body of still water, or an artificial basin for swimming.
sentences: We swam in the outdoor pool.
The swimming pool is open all year.
She jumped into the cool pool.

words.definition: A gymnasium, especially a facility for indoor sports.
sentences: I go to the gym three times a week.
The school gym is used for basketball.
He lifts weights at the gym.

words.definition: A session of physical exercise or training.
sentences: I had a great workout this morning.
She does a full-body workout every other day.
A good workout makes you feel energized.

words.definition: A period of gentle exercise or practice to prepare for more strenuous activity.
sentences: Always do a warm-up before exercising.
The team did a quick warm-up before the game.
A proper warm-up prevents injuries.

words.definition: A period of gentle exercise to allow the body to recover after strenuous activity.
sentences: Don't forget your cool-down after running.
The cool-down helps your muscles relax.
A short cool-down is important for flexibility.

words.definition: The action of extending a limb or one's entire body to its full length.
sentences: Stretching helps improve flexibility.
I do stretching exercises daily.
Proper stretching can prevent muscle soreness.

words.definition: The quality or state of being physically strong.
sentences: He has incredible physical strength.
Lifting weights builds strength.
Strength training is part of his routine.

words.definition: The ability to continue an unpleasant or difficult process or situation without giving up.
sentences: Running a marathon requires great endurance.
She has amazing endurance in long races.
Building endurance takes time and practice.

words.definition: The quality of bending easily without breaking.
sentences: Yoga improves flexibility.
Good flexibility helps prevent injuries.
She has excellent flexibility.

words.definition: The ability to move quickly and easily.
sentences: The soccer player showed great agility.
Agility is important in many sports.
Training improves your agility.

words.definition: An even distribution of weight enabling someone or something to remain upright and steady.
sentences: Good balance is important for gymnastics.
She practiced her balance on one leg.
Yoga can help improve your balance.

words.definition: The ability to use different parts of the body together smoothly and efficiently.
sentences: Playing tennis requires good hand-eye coordination.
She has excellent coordination.
Activities like juggling improve coordination.

words.definition: The rate at which someone or something is able to move or operate.
sentences: The runner showed incredible speed.
Speed is crucial in short races.
He trained to increase his speed.

words.definition: The ability or capacity to do something or act in a particular way.
sentences: The boxer had immense power in his punch.
Power training helps athletes jump higher.
She hit the ball with great power.

words.definition: The ability to sustain prolonged physical or mental effort.
sentences: Running long distances builds stamina.
She has incredible stamina.
Good stamina is important for endurance sports.

words.definition: Relating to, involving, or requiring free oxygen, especially in exercise that improves oxygen consumption by the body.
sentences: Running is an aerobic exercise.
Aerobic activities strengthen your heart.
She enjoys aerobic dance classes.

words.definition: Relating to, involving, or requiring an absence of free oxygen, especially in exercise that involves short bursts of intense activity.
sentences: Sprinting is an anaerobic exercise.
Anaerobic workouts build muscle mass.
Weightlifting is an example of anaerobic training.

words.definition: Short for cardiovascular exercise, which strengthens the heart and lungs.
sentences: I do cardio for 30 minutes every day.
Running is good cardio.
Cardio helps burn calories.

words.definition: Physical exercise specializing in the use of resistance to induce muscular contraction which builds the strength, anaerobic endurance, and size of skeletal muscles.
sentences: Strength training is important for overall fitness.
He includes strength training in his routine.
Strength training helps prevent bone loss.

words.definition: The sport or activity of lifting heavy weights.
sentences: He started weightlifting to build muscle.
Weightlifting can be dangerous if not done correctly.
She competes in weightlifting competitions.

words.definition: A Hindu spiritual and ascetic discipline, a part of which, including breath control, simple meditation, and the adoption of specific bodily postures, is widely practiced for health and relaxation.
sentences: Yoga helps me relax and stay flexible.
She practices yoga every morning.
Yoga can improve both physical and mental well-being.

words.definition: A system of physical exercises developed by Joseph Pilates, emphasizing core strength, flexibility, and body awareness.
sentences: Pilates focuses on strengthening the core.
She takes Pilates classes twice a week.
Pilates can help improve posture.

words.definition: The action of moving rapidly on foot.
sentences: Running is a great way to stay fit.
He enjoys running in the park.
She is training for a long-distance running race.

words.definition: The sport or activity of propelling oneself through water using the limbs.
sentences: Swimming is a full-body workout.
She loves swimming in the ocean.
He takes swimming lessons every summer.

words.definition: The sport or activity of riding a bicycle.
sentences: Cycling is a popular way to exercise.
They went cycling in the mountains.
Cycling is good for your legs.

words.definition: The activity of walking long distances, especially in the country or woods.
sentences: We went hiking in the national park.
Hiking is a great way to explore nature.
She enjoys hiking on weekends.

words.definition: The action of moving along on foot at a moderate pace.
sentences: Walking is a simple and effective exercise.
I enjoy walking my dog every day.
Walking helps clear your mind.

words.definition: The action of running at a steady, gentle pace.
sentences: He goes jogging every morning.
Jogging is less intense than running.
She enjoys jogging in the fresh air.

words.definition: Running at full speed over a short distance.
sentences: The athlete excelled at sprinting.
Sprinting requires explosive power.
He trained for sprinting competitions.

words.definition: A long-distance running race, strictly 26 miles 385 yards (42.195 km).
sentences: She trained for a year to run the marathon.
Running a marathon is a huge achievement.
The city hosts an annual marathon.

words.definition: An athletic contest consisting of three different events, typically swimming, cycling, and long-distance running.
sentences: He competed in his first triathlon.
A triathlon tests a person's all-around fitness.
Training for a triathlon requires dedication.

words.definition: A team sport played with a ball between two teams of 11 players. The game is played by kicking the ball to score goals.
sentences: Football is the most popular sport in the world.
They played a game of football in the park.
He dreams of becoming a professional football player.

words.definition: A team sport in which two teams, most commonly of five players each, oppose one another on a rectangular court, compete with the primary objective of shooting a basketball through the opponent's hoop.
sentences: Basketball is a fast-paced game.
She plays basketball for her school team.
The basketball game went into overtime.

words.definition: A racquet sport played by two players (singles) or two teams of two players (doubles) on a rectangular court divided by a net.
sentences: They played a friendly game of tennis.
Tennis requires good hand-eye coordination.
She watches professional tennis tournaments.

words.definition: A team sport in which two teams of six players are separated by a net. Each team tries to score points by grounding a ball on the other team's side of the court under organized rules.
sentences: We played volleyball on the beach.
Volleyball is a fun team sport.
She is good at spiking the volleyball.

words.definition: A bat-and-ball game played between two teams of nine players who take turns batting and fielding.
sentences: Baseball is very popular in America.
He hit a home run in the baseball game.
They went to a baseball stadium.

words.definition: A bat-and-ball game played between two teams of 11 players on a field at the centre of which is a 22-yard (20-metre) pitch with a wicket at each end, each comprising two bails balanced on three stumps.
sentences: Cricket is a popular sport in India.
The cricket match lasted all day.
He scored a century in the cricket game.

words.definition: A team game played with an oval ball that may be kicked, carried, and passed by hand. Points are scored by carrying or kicking the ball to the opponents' goal line.
sentences: Rugby is a very physical sport.
He plays rugby for his club.
The rugby team trained hard.

words.definition: A team sport played by two teams of 11 players on a rectangular field with goalposts at each end. The offense attempts to advance an oval ball down the field by running with it or throwing it.
sentences: American Football is very popular in the US.
They watched the American Football game on Sunday.
The quarterback threw a long pass in American Football.

words.definition: A game played on a field or on ice between two teams of 11 players (field hockey) or 6 players (ice hockey) who use curved sticks to drive a small ball or puck into the opponent's goal.
sentences: Ice hockey is a fast and exciting sport.
She plays field hockey for her school.
The hockey game was very intense.

words.definition: A game played on a large open-air course with 9 or 18 holes, the object being to propel a small hard ball into each hole in as few strokes as possible using a variety of clubs.
sentences: He enjoys playing golf on weekends.
Golf requires precision and patience.
The golf course was beautiful.

words.definition: A racquet sport played using racquets to hit a shuttlecock across a net.
sentences: We played badminton in the backyard.
Badminton is a fast-paced game.
She is very good at badminton.

words.definition: An indoor game played on a table divided by a net, in which two or four players hit a lightweight ball back and forth using small rackets.
sentences: Table tennis is also known as ping-pong.
They played a competitive game of table tennis.
Table tennis requires quick reflexes.

words.definition: A combat sport in which two people, usually wearing protective gloves, throw punches at each other for a predetermined set of time in a boxing ring.
sentences: Boxing requires strength and strategy.
He trains in boxing every day.
The boxing match was intense.

words.definition: Various sports or skills, mainly of Japanese and Chinese origin, that involve combat and self-defense.
sentences: She studies martial arts for self-defense.
Martial arts teach discipline.
Karate and judo are types of martial arts.

words.definition: Exercises developing or displaying physical agility and coordination.
sentences: Gymnastics requires great strength and flexibility.
She is a talented gymnast.
The gymnastics competition was exciting.

words.definition: The general term for competitive running, jumping, throwing, and walking events.
sentences: He excels in various athletics events.
Athletics are a core part of the Olympic Games.
She trains hard for track and field athletics.

words.definition: A group of sports events that includes running, jumping, and throwing.
sentences: She competes in track and field events.
Track and field is a popular sport in schools.
He won a medal in track and field.

words.definition: The sport or activity of lifting heavy weights.
sentences: He started weightlifting to build muscle.
Weightlifting can be dangerous if not done correctly.
She competes in weightlifting competitions.

words.definition: The practice of strengthening and enlarging the muscles of the body through exercise.
sentences: Bodybuilding requires dedication and strict diet.
He competes in bodybuilding contests.
Bodybuilding focuses on muscle definition.

words.definition: A branded fitness regimen that involves constantly varied functional movements performed at high intensity across broad time and modal domains.
sentences: CrossFit workouts are very challenging.
She enjoys the community aspect of CrossFit.
He trains for CrossFit competitions.

words.definition: A fitness program that involves cardio and Latin-inspired dance.
sentences: Zumba is a fun way to exercise.
She takes Zumba classes to stay active.
Zumba combines dance and fitness.

words.definition: A system of exercises designed to improve the circulation of oxygen through the body.
sentences: She does aerobics to improve her cardiovascular health.
Aerobics classes are very energetic.
Aerobics helps build stamina.

words.definition: A system of physical exercises developed by Joseph Pilates, emphasizing core strength, flexibility, and body awareness.
sentences: Pilates focuses on strengthening the core.
She takes Pilates classes twice a week.
Pilates can help improve posture.

words.definition: A Hindu spiritual and ascetic discipline, a part of which, including breath control, simple meditation, and the adoption of specific bodily postures, is widely practiced for health and relaxation.
sentences: Yoga helps me relax and stay flexible.
She practices yoga every morning.
Yoga can improve both physical and mental well-being.

words.definition: The practice of focusing one's mind for a period of time, in silence or with the aid of chanting, for religious or spiritual purposes or as a method of relaxation.
sentences: Meditation helps reduce stress.
She practices meditation daily.
Meditation can improve focus.

words.definition: The quality or state of being conscious or aware of something.
sentences: Mindfulness can help you live in the present moment.
She practices mindfulness through meditation.
Mindfulness helps reduce anxiety.

words.definition: The process of providing or obtaining the food necessary for health and growth.
sentences: Good nutrition is essential for fitness.
She studies nutrition to help people eat healthier.
Proper nutrition fuels your body.

words.definition: The kinds of food that a person, animal, or community habitually eats.
sentences: He follows a healthy diet.
Eating a balanced diet is important.
Her diet includes lots of fruits and vegetables.

words.definition: The process of causing something to absorb water.
sentences: Proper hydration is key for athletes.
Drink plenty of water for good hydration.
Lack of hydration can cause headaches.

words.definition: Something that completes or enhances something else when added to it.
sentences: Some athletes take protein supplements.
Dietary supplements can provide extra nutrients.
Always consult a doctor before taking supplements.

words.definition: A unit of energy supplied by food.
sentences: Count your calories if you want to lose weight.
Fruits are low in calories.
Active people need more calories.

words.definition: A macronutrient essential for building muscle mass.
sentences: Meat and beans are good sources of protein.
Protein helps repair muscles after exercise.
Athletes need a lot of protein.

words.definition: Macronutrients that provide energy for the body.
sentences: Bread and pasta are rich in carbohydrates.
Carbohydrates are important for energy during exercise.
Athletes often 'carb-load' before a race.

words.definition: Macronutrients that provide energy and help absorb vitamins.
sentences: Healthy fats are important for your diet.
Avocados contain good fats.
Fats provide long-lasting energy.

words.definition: Organic compounds that are essential for normal growth and nutrition and are required in small quantities in the diet because they cannot be synthesized by the body.
sentences: Fruits and vegetables are full of vitamins.
Vitamins are important for a strong immune system.
Take your daily vitamins.

words.definition: Inorganic substances that the body needs for various functions.
sentences: Calcium and iron are important minerals.
Minerals are found in many foods.
They are essential for healthy bones and teeth.

words.definition: The process of causing something to absorb water.
sentences: Proper hydration is key for athletes.
Drink plenty of water for good hydration.
Lack of hydration can cause headaches.

words.definition: A period of gentle exercise or practice to prepare for more strenuous activity.
sentences: Always do a warm-up before exercising.
The team did a quick warm-up before the game.
A proper warm-up prevents injuries.

words.definition: A period of gentle exercise to allow the body to recover after strenuous activity.
sentences: Don't forget your cool-down after running.
The cool-down helps your muscles relax.
A short cool-down is important for flexibility.

words.definition: The action of extending a limb or one's entire body to its full length.
sentences: Stretching helps improve flexibility.
I do stretching exercises daily.
Proper stretching can prevent muscle soreness.

words.definition: Harm or damage to a person's body.
sentences: He suffered a knee injury during the game.
Always warm up to prevent injury.
The injury kept him from playing for weeks.

words.definition: The action of restoring someone to health or normal life through training and therapy after injury or illness.
sentences: He underwent rehabilitation after his surgery.
Rehabilitation helps athletes recover from injuries.
The clinic specializes in sports rehabilitation.

words.definition: The treatment of disease, injury, or deformity by physical methods such as massage, heat treatment, and exercise rather than by drugs or surgery.
sentences: She needed physiotherapy after her accident.
Physiotherapy helps restore movement.
The physiotherapist designed a recovery plan.

words.definition: The rubbing and kneading of muscles and joints of the body with the hands or an instrument.
sentences: A deep tissue massage can relieve muscle pain.
She enjoys getting a massage after a long week.
Massage helps improve blood circulation.

words.definition: A person who is proficient in sports and other forms of physical exercise.
sentences: She is a talented young athlete.
Athletes train very hard.
Being an athlete requires discipline.

words.definition: A major international multi-sport event, occurring every four years.
sentences: He dreams of competing in the Olympics.
The Olympics bring athletes from around the world.
The next Olympics will be held in Paris.

words.definition: A major international multi-sport event for athletes with disabilities, occurring every four years after the Olympic Games.
sentences: The Paralympics showcase incredible athletic ability.
She hopes to compete in the Paralympics.
The Paralympics inspire many people.

words.definition: A metal disk given as an award for winning a competition or for bravery.
sentences: He won a gold medal in swimming.
She has many medals from her competitions.
The athlete proudly displayed his medal.

words.definition: A cup or other decorative object awarded as a prize for a victory or success.
sentences: The team received a large trophy.
He keeps his trophies on a shelf.
Winning the trophy was a great achievement.

words.definition: A contest for the position of champion in a sport or game.
sentences: Our team won the national championship.
The championship game was very exciting.
She trained hard for the championship.

words.definition: A series of contests between a number of competitors, competing for an overall prize.
sentences: They entered a chess tournament.
The tennis tournament lasted a week.
The tournament attracted many skilled players.

words.definition: A group of sports clubs or teams that compete against each other at a particular level.
sentences: Our team plays in the local league.
She dreams of playing in a professional league.
The league has strict rules.

words.definition: A person who is enthusiastically devoted to something or someone, such as a sports team or celebrity.
sentences: He is a big fan of the local football team.
The fans cheered loudly for their team.
She is a dedicated sports fan.

words.definition: A person who watches at a show, game, or other event.
sentences: Thousands of spectators attended the game.
The spectators cheered for both teams.
Spectators filled the stadium.

words.definition: An official who watches a game or match closely to ensure that the rules are followed.
sentences: The referee blew the whistle.
The referee made a fair decision.
Players must respect the referee's calls.

words.definition: An official who watches a game (especially baseball or tennis) to ensure that the rules are followed.
sentences: The umpire called the ball out.
The umpire's decision was final.
Umpires are important in cricket and baseball.

words.definition: A person holding public office or having official duties, or a person who officiates at a sporting event.
sentences: The game official made a controversial call.
Officials ensure fair play.
The official checked the equipment.

words.definition: One of a set of explicit or understood regulations or principles governing conduct or procedure within a particular area of activity.
sentences: Every sport has its own rules.
You must follow the rules of the game.
Breaking the rules leads to penalties.

words.definition: Respect for the rules or for an opponent in sports or games.
sentences: Good sportsmanship means fair play.
Fair play is important in all competitions.
The team was praised for its fair play.

words.definition: Fair and generous behavior or treatment of others, especially in a sports contest.
sentences: He showed great sportsmanship after losing.
Good sportsmanship is about respecting your opponents.
The coach emphasized sportsmanship.

words.definition: The practice of training people to obey rules or a code of behavior, using punishment to correct disobedience.
sentences: Athletes need a lot of discipline.
Discipline is key to achieving goals.
He showed great discipline in his training.

words.definition: The quality of being committed to a task or purpose.
sentences: Her dedication to training paid off.
Dedication is essential for success in sports.
He showed great dedication to his team.

words.definition: The actual application or use of an idea, belief, or method, as opposed to theories relating to it.
sentences: We have soccer practice every Tuesday.
Practice makes perfect.
She attends dance practice daily.

words.definition: The action of teaching a person or animal a particular skill or type of behavior.
sentences: He is in intense training for the marathon.
Training helps athletes improve.
The team's training schedule is very demanding.

words.definition: A period of gentle exercise or practice to prepare for more strenuous activity.
sentences: Always do a warm-up before exercising.
The team did a quick warm-up before the game.
A proper warm-up prevents injuries.

words.definition: A period of gentle exercise to allow the body to recover after strenuous activity.
sentences: Don't forget your cool-down after running.
The cool-down helps your muscles relax.
A short cool-down is important for flexibility.

words.definition: The action of extending a limb or one's entire body to its full length.
sentences: Stretching helps improve flexibility.
I do stretching exercises daily.
Proper stretching can prevent muscle soreness.

words.definition: Harm or damage to a person's body.
sentences: He suffered a knee injury during the game.
Always warm up to prevent injury.
The injury kept him from playing for weeks.

words.definition: A return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength.
sentences: He focused on his recovery after the injury.
Proper rest is important for muscle recovery.
Her recovery was slow but steady.

words.definition: Cease from action or motion in order to relax, sleep, or recover strength.
sentences: It's important to rest after a hard workout.
Give your muscles time to rest.
He took a day of rest from training.

words.definition: A condition of body and mind such as that which typically recurs for several hours every night, in which the nervous system is inactive, the eyes closed, the postural muscles relaxed, and consciousness practically suspended.
sentences: Getting enough sleep is crucial for athletes.
Lack of sleep can affect your performance.
Aim for 7-8 hours of sleep each night.

words.definition: The process of causing something to absorb water.
sentences: Proper hydration is key for athletes.
Drink plenty of water for good hydration.
Lack of hydration can cause headaches.

words.definition: The process of providing or obtaining the food necessary for health and growth.
sentences: Good nutrition is essential for fitness.
She studies nutrition to help people eat healthier.
Proper nutrition fuels your body.

words.definition: The kinds of food that a person, animal, or community habitually eats.
sentences: He follows a healthy diet.
Eating a balanced diet is important.
Her diet includes lots of fruits and vegetables.

words.definition: Something that completes or enhances something else when added to it.
sentences: Some athletes take protein supplements.
Dietary supplements can provide extra nutrients.
Always consult a doctor before taking supplements.

words.definition: The necessary items for a particular purpose.
sentences: You need special equipment for rock climbing.
The gym has new exercise equipment.
Make sure your sports equipment is safe.

words.definition: Equipment or clothing for a particular activity.
sentences: He packed his hiking gear.
Always wear proper safety gear.
She bought new running gear.

words.definition: The distinctive clothing worn by members of the same organization or body or by children attending certain schools.
sentences: The team wore new uniforms.
Every player must wear the correct uniform.
The uniform was blue and white.

words.definition: A hard or padded protective hat, worn in various sports or professions.
sentences: Always wear a helmet when cycling.
The football player wore a strong helmet.
The construction worker put on his helmet.

words.definition: Spectacles worn to protect a person's eyes from dust, wind, or water.
sentences: She wore goggles while swimming.
Goggles protect your eyes from chlorine.
He put on his goggles before diving.

words.definition: Pieces of soft, thick material used to protect something or to make it more comfortable.
sentences: The hockey player wore shin pads.
Protective pads are important in many sports.
He put on his knee pads.

words.definition: A covering for the hand worn for protection against cold or dirt and typically having separate sheaths for each finger and the thumb.
sentences: The boxer wore thick gloves.
Goalkeepers wear special gloves.
She put on her cycling gloves.

words.definition: A covering for the foot, typically made of leather, with a sturdy sole and not reaching above the ankle.
sentences: Wear appropriate shoes for running.
He bought new athletic shoes.
Her tennis shoes had good grip.

words.definition: A solid or hollow sphere or ovoid, especially one that is kicked, thrown, or hit in a game.
sentences: The children played with a colorful ball.
The soccer ball rolled out of bounds.
He threw the baseball to his friend.

words.definition: A heavy wooden club with a handle, used in baseball and cricket to hit the ball.
sentences: He swung the baseball bat.
The cricket bat was made of willow.
She hit the ball hard with the bat.

words.definition: A bat with a long handle and a round or oval frame with an open network of strings or catgut, used in tennis, badminton, and squash.
sentences: She held the tennis racket tightly.
He bought a new badminton racket.
The strings of the racket were broken.

words.definition: A barrier of netting used in various games, such as tennis or volleyball.
sentences: The volleyball went over the net.
The tennis court has a high net.
The ball hit the net.

words.definition: A clear, high-pitched sound made by forcing breath through a small hole between one's lips or teeth, or through a small device.
sentences: The referee blew his whistle.
The coach used a whistle to get attention.
The game started with a loud whistle.

words.definition: A large board on which the score of a game or match is displayed.
sentences: We checked the scoreboard to see the score.
The scoreboard showed our team was winning.
The electronic scoreboard updated quickly.

words.definition: A device that measures and displays the time taken for an event.
sentences: The coach used a timer for the sprints.
Set the timer for 30 minutes.
The timer buzzed when the time was up.

words.definition: One circuit of a track or course in a race.
sentences: She ran another lap around the track.
He finished the last lap of the race.
The runners completed ten laps.

words.definition: A competition of speed, as in running, driving, or sailing.
sentences: He won the 100-meter race.
The car race was very exciting.
She trained hard for the big race.

words.definition: Run at full speed over a short distance.
sentences: He did a quick sprint to the finish line.
Sprinting is an explosive exercise.
The athlete trained for short sprints.

words.definition: Push oneself off a surface and into the air by using the muscles in one's legs and feet.
sentences: She can jump very high.
He performed a long jump.
The athlete prepared for the high jump.

words.definition: Propel (something) with force through the air by a rapid movement of the arm and hand.
sentences: He can throw a baseball very far.
The javelin throw is an Olympic event.
She practices throwing the discus.

words.definition: Strike or propel forcefully with the foot.
sentences: He kicked the soccer ball into the net.
She learned a powerful kick in martial arts.
The horse gave a strong kick.

words.definition: Strike (someone or something) with a forceful blow.
sentences: He hit the baseball out of the park.
She hit the tennis ball over the net.
The golfer hit the ball far.

words.definition: Intercept and hold (something which has been thrown, propelled, or dropped).
sentences: He made an amazing catch in the outfield.
Can you catch this ball?
The goalkeeper made a great catch.

words.definition: In tennis and other racket sports, to hit the ball to begin a point.
sentences: She has a powerful serve in tennis.
It's his turn to serve.
The player practiced his serve.

words.definition: In tennis or soccer, to hit the ball before it bounces.
sentences: He hit a perfect volley in tennis.
She scored with a strong volley.
The volleyball player made a great volley.

words.definition: In sports like basketball or soccer, to move the ball by bouncing or kicking it repeatedly.
sentences: He dribbled the basketball down the court.
The soccer player dribbled the ball past the defenders.
Learning to dribble well is important.

words.definition: To kick, throw, or hit the ball to a teammate.
sentences: He made a perfect pass to his teammate.
Pass the ball to me!
The quarterback threw a long pass.

words.definition: To try to score a goal by kicking or throwing the ball.
sentences: He shot the basketball towards the hoop.
She took a powerful shot on goal.
The player shot from a long distance.

words.definition: In sports like football or rugby, to confront or stop an opponent by seizing them and throwing them to the ground.
sentences: He made a strong tackle to stop the opponent.
The defender made a clean tackle.
Tackling is a key part of rugby.

words.definition: An unfair or illegal act in a game or sport.
sentences: The referee called a foul.
He committed a foul by tripping his opponent.
A foul resulted in a free kick.

words.definition: A punishment imposed for breaking a law, rule, or contract.
sentences: The team received a penalty for the foul.
He scored from the penalty spot.
The penalty resulted in a free throw.

words.definition: In soccer and other sports, being in a position where playing the ball is illegal.
sentences: The referee blew the whistle for offside.
The goal was disallowed because of offside.
Understanding the offside rule can be tricky.

words.definition: A brief suspension of play in a game or sport.
sentences: The coach called a timeout.
During the timeout, the team discussed strategy.
We took a timeout to catch our breath.

words.definition: The interval between the two halves of a game or match.
sentences: The team discussed their strategy at half-time.
We grabbed snacks during half-time.
The score was tied at half-time.

words.definition: The end of a game or match.
sentences: The referee blew the whistle for full-time.
Our team won at full-time.
The score was 2-1 at full-time.

words.definition: Additional time played in a game when the scores are tied at the end of regular play.
sentences: The game went into overtime.
They won the game in overtime.
Overtime is very exciting for fans.

words.definition: A game or match in which two or more contestants finish with the same score; a tie.
sentences: The soccer match ended in a draw.
Neither team could score, so it was a draw.
A draw means no one wins.

words.definition: A game or match in which two or more contestants finish with the same score; a draw.
sentences: The game ended in a tie.
We had a tie in the last round.
A tie means both teams get points.

words.definition: In boxing, a blow that renders an opponent unconscious; in a tournament, a defeat that eliminates a competitor.
sentences: The boxer won by knockout.
Our team was eliminated in the knockout round.
It was a stunning knockout victory.

words.definition: A person who has defeated all opponents in a competition or series of competitions, especially in sports.
sentences: He is the boxing champion.
Our team became the champions.
She is a true champion.

words.definition: The best performance or highest achievement officially recorded in a particular sport or activity.
sentences: He broke the world record in sprinting.
She set a new personal record.
The athlete aims to break the record.

words.definition: An individual's best performance in a particular sport or event.
sentences: She achieved a new personal best in the race.
He always tries to beat his personal best.
A personal best is a great achievement.

words.definition: Respect for the rules or for an opponent in sports or games.
sentences: Good sportsmanship means fair play.
Fair play is important in all competitions.
The team was praised for its fair play.

words.definition: Fair and generous behavior or treatment of others, especially in a sports contest.
sentences: He showed great sportsmanship after losing.
Good sportsmanship is about respecting your opponents.
The coach emphasized sportsmanship.

words.definition: The combined action of a group of people, especially when effective and efficient.
sentences: Teamwork is essential for success in team sports.
Our project succeeded due to great teamwork.
Good teamwork makes any task easier.

words.definition: A plan of action or policy designed to achieve a major or overall aim.
sentences: The coach devised a new strategy for the game.
Their strategy helped them win.
A good strategy is important in sports.

words.definition: The art of disposing troops (or forces) in an order for battle and maneuvering them in action.
sentences: The team changed their tactics at half-time.
Good tactics can surprise opponents.
They discussed various tactics before the match.

words.definition: The attacking side in a game or sport.
sentences: Our team has a strong offense.
The offense tried to score a touchdown.
They focused on improving their offense.

words.definition: The action of defending or protecting from attack.
sentences: Our team has a solid defense.
The defense stopped the opponent's attack.
Good defense is key to winning games.

words.definition: A person or thing competing with another for the same objective or superiority.
sentences: Our team played against our biggest rival.
The two athletes are long-standing rivals.
Competition with a rival can push you to improve.

words.definition: A sports contest between two local rivals.
sentences: The local football derby was very intense.
Fans eagerly awaited the city derby.
Derby matches are always exciting.

words.definition: A competitor thought to have little chance of winning a fight or contest.
sentences: Our team was the underdog, but we won!
Everyone loves to cheer for the underdog.
The underdog surprised everyone with his performance.

words.definition: A competitor or team considered most likely to win.
sentences: They were the favorites to win the tournament.
The favorite team lost unexpectedly.
He is the favorite to win the gold medal.

words.definition: A return to success or prominence, especially after retirement or a period of decline.
sentences: The team made an incredible comeback in the second half.
It was a stunning comeback victory.
The injured athlete made a strong comeback.

words.definition: An unexpected defeat of a strong opponent.
sentences: The small team caused a major upset.
It was a huge upset in the tournament.
The underdog created an upset.

words.definition: Additional time played in a game when the scores are tied at the end of regular play.
sentences: The game went into overtime.
They won the game in overtime.
Overtime is very exciting for fans.

words.definition: A method of deciding a tied contest in which the first competitor to score wins.
sentences: The game was decided by sudden death overtime.
Sudden death adds a lot of pressure.
They won in sudden death.

words.definition: A series of games played to determine a champion or to decide promotion or relegation.
sentences: Our team made it to the playoffs.
The playoffs are the most exciting part of the season.
They won the playoff series.

words.definition: The last game or round in a competition, usually between the two remaining competitors or teams.
sentences: They are playing in the finals next week.
Winning the finals is the ultimate goal.
The finals were very intense.

words.definition: A round in a competition immediately preceding the final, in which four competitors or teams play to decide the two finalists.
sentences: Our team lost in the semi-finals.
The semi-finals matches were very close.
They advanced to the semi-finals.

words.definition: A round in a competition immediately preceding the semi-finals, in which eight competitors or teams play to decide the four semi-finalists.
sentences: They won their quarter-finals match.
The quarter-finals were full of surprises.
Only eight teams made it to the quarter-finals.

words.definition: A stage in a competition.
sentences: We won the first round of the tournament.
The next round will be tougher.
She advanced to the next round.

words.definition: A diagram showing the schedule of games in a tournament, especially one with a knockout format.
sentences: Fill out your tournament bracket.
My bracket was completely busted.
The bracket shows who plays whom.

words.definition: The process of ranking competitors in a tournament so that the best players or teams do not meet until later rounds.
sentences: She received a high seeding in the tennis tournament.
Seeding helps ensure fair competition.
The top players get a better seeding.

words.definition: The position of a competitor or team that is not required to play in an early round of a tournament but advances to the next round.
sentences: Our team got a bye in the first round.
A bye means you don't play that round.
She received a bye in the competition.

words.definition: An easy victory, especially one in which the opponent fails to appear.
sentences: Our team won by walkover when the other team didn't show up.
It was a walkover victory.
He won the match by walkover.

words.definition: To lose or give up something as a penalty for wrongdoing or a consequence of a rule.
sentences: Our team had to forfeit the game due to lack of players.
They had to forfeit the match.
Forfeit means you lose by default.

words.definition: The act of making someone ineligible to participate in an activity or competition.
sentences: He faced disqualification for cheating.
The athlete's disqualification was controversial.
Disqualification means you are out of the competition.

words.definition: The action of suspending someone from an office or position.
sentences: He received a suspension for breaking the rules.
The player's suspension lasted three games.
A suspension means you cannot play for a period.

words.definition: Officially or legally prohibit (something).
sentences: He received a lifetime ban from the sport.
The use of certain substances is banned in sports.
The ban prevented him from competing.

words.definition: The use of an illegal drug to enhance performance in a sport.
sentences: Doping is a serious offense in sports.
The athlete was caught doping.
Anti-doping agencies test athletes.

words.definition: Respect for the rules or for an opponent in sports or games.
sentences: Good sportsmanship means fair play.
Fair play is important in all competitions.
The team was praised for its fair play.

words.definition: Fair and generous behavior or treatment of others, especially in a sports contest.
sentences: He showed great sportsmanship after losing.
Good sportsmanship is about respecting your opponents.
The coach emphasized sportsmanship.

words.definition: The feeling of loyalty and enthusiasm among the members of a team.
sentences: Our team has great team spirit.
Good team spirit helps overcome challenges.
The coach fostered strong team spirit.

words.definition: The reason or reasons for acting or behaving in a particular way.
sentences: His motivation to win was very strong.
The coach provided great motivation.
Lack of motivation can affect performance.

words.definition: The practice of training people to obey rules or a code of behavior, using punishment to correct disobedience.
sentences: Athletes need a lot of discipline.
Discipline is key to achieving goals.
He showed great discipline in his training.

words.definition: The quality of being committed to a task or purpose.
sentences: Her dedication to training paid off.
Dedication is essential for success in sports.
He showed great dedication to his team.

words.definition: Persistence in doing something despite difficulty or delay in achieving success.
sentences: Perseverance is important when facing challenges.
Her perseverance helped her achieve her dreams.
He showed great perseverance in his recovery.

words.definition: The capacity to recover quickly from difficulties; toughness.
sentences: Athletes need mental resilience.
Her resilience helped her bounce back from defeat.
Building resilience is important for life.

words.definition: The ability to remain focused and confident, especially when under pressure.
sentences: Mental toughness is crucial in high-pressure games.
He has incredible mental toughness.
Developing mental toughness takes practice.

words.definition: The center of interest or activity.
sentences: Maintain your focus during the game.
He has a strong focus on his goals.
Lack of focus can lead to mistakes.

words.definition: The action or power of focusing one's attention or mental effort.
sentences: Good concentration is important for accuracy.
She needs quiet to maintain her concentration.
His concentration was unbroken during the match.

words.definition: The formation of a mental image of something.
sentences: Athletes use visualization to prepare for competition.
Visualization can improve performance.
She practiced visualization before her big race.

words.definition: The process of identifying something that you want to achieve and planning the steps to take to achieve it.
sentences: Goal setting helps athletes stay motivated.
She uses goal setting to track her progress.
Effective goal setting is crucial for success.

words.definition: An act of presenting a play, concert, or other form of entertainment.
sentences: His performance in the game was outstanding.
She always strives for her best performance.
The team's performance improved significantly.

words.definition: The act or process of improving something.
sentences: He showed great improvement in his skills.
Continuous improvement is important for athletes.
The coach noted her rapid improvement.

words.definition: Forward or onward movement toward a destination.
sentences: She made good progress in her training.
Track your progress to stay motivated.
His progress was slow but steady.

words.definition: A thing done successfully, typically by effort, courage, or skill.
sentences: Winning the medal was a great achievement.
His achievements in sports are remarkable.
Every small achievement is worth celebrating.

words.definition: The accomplishment of an aim or purpose.
sentences: Hard work leads to success.
She achieved great success in her career.
Success often comes after many failures.

words.definition: Lack of success.
sentences: Don't be afraid of failure.
Learn from your failures.
Failure can be a stepping stone to success.

words.definition: A call to someone to participate in a competitive situation or fight to decide who is superior in terms of ability or strength.
sentences: He accepted the challenge to run a marathon.
The new workout routine was a real challenge.
Challenges help you grow.

words.definition: A thing that blocks one's way or prevents or hinders progress.
sentences: He overcame many obstacles to achieve his goal.
An injury was a major obstacle for the athlete.
Every obstacle can be a learning opportunity.

words.definition: Difficulties; misfortune.
sentences: She showed great strength in the face of adversity.
Adversity can make you stronger.
They faced many adversities during the season.

words.definition: A great victory or achievement.
sentences: It was a moment of great triumph for the team.
Their triumph was celebrated by all.
He achieved a personal triumph.
